instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .
definitions.PM_SLP_SUS_L:
What is PM_SLP_SUS_L? 
The "PM_SLP_SUS_L" signal in a MacBook is related to the power management of the device, specifically concerning the 'suspend to RAM' state or S3 state. It's an active-low signal that, when asserted (low voltage), indicates the system should enter or is in the S3 sleep state. .
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.SYS_ONEWIRE: What is SYS_ONEWIRE? This is a bidirectional communication line between the system management controller(SMC) and the charger that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC. This must be working for the light to come on on the magsafe charger. .
definitions.SMC_BATLOW_L: What is SMC_BATLOW_L? SMC_BATLOW_L refers to a power management signal that indicates a low battery condition. The "_L" suffix suggests that this is an active-low signal, meaning that it becomes low when the battery reaches a low voltage threshold..
definitions.PP_BUS_G3H: What is PP_BUS_G3H? This is a typo of PPBUS_G3H When you see PP_BUS_G3H, assume they meant to type PPBUS_G3H.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light,
threads.message:
not liquid damage, no corrosion. there is green light. fan doesn't spin. light doesn't change to orange when i connect to a battery.

<SIGNAL>PP_BUS_G3H</SIGNAL>= 12.59
<SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL> = 3.431
pp3v42 = 3.45v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> = 0
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> = 0
<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> = 3.4v
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.53v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> = 0
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> = 0
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> = 3.42v
<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> = 1v
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_SUS_L</SIGNAL> = 0v
<SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> = 0v
<SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> = 0

<CHIP>U7200</CHIP> pin 16 is 12.59v
no 32khz clock signal because missing <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>.
0.510 ohms in diode mode on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>



PPBUS is present at <TRANSISTOR>Q7220</TRANSISTOR> but <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> is 0v
bad <CHIP>U7200</CHIP>? - the only pin has voltage it is pin 16.
could be bad SMC. 0v on <SIGNAL>SMC_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> when i connect battery and magsafe.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light,
threads.message: Is PP3v42 3.4 of 4.4? If 4.4, that’s too high and could be causing issues. If 3.4, resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light,
threads.message:
ops sorry 3.45v on pp3v42.


pins 17/18 and 27/28 = 3.2 ohms and 20 ohms

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light,
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light,
threads.message:
<CHIP>U7941</CHIP>

pin1 - 3.45
pin2 - 1v
pin3 - 0v
pin4 - 3.4v
pin5 - GND
pin6 - 0v
pin7 - 0v
pin8 - 0v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light,
threads.message:
i found Pin2 of <CHIP>U7841</CHIP> in diode mode is 0.059

dead smc

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light,
threads.message:
What is <CHIP>U2841</CHIP>???

"pin2 - 1v"
<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> is too low.
Is there where you have .059 in diode mode?
If yes, remove <CHIP>U7941</CHIP> and check again.
If still low, put quality flux and reflow SMC.
Low value again, means you must change SMC...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light,
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light,
threads.message:
i've removed <CHIP>U7941</CHIP> its still low, then i removed smc its still low. board has a internal short?


should i inject 3v to <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL>, see where get hot?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light,
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> is shared only between SMC and <CHIP>U7941</CHIP>.
There is no other component connected.
059 diode mode value means 100 ohms maybe (or more), so I bet you cannot heat anything injecting voltage.

Depending where is the trace pulled down to ground, sometime is possible to isolate that point and bypass it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light,
threads.message: Yeah i know. I guess i better not to inject voltage and risk of burning another trace. I’ll have to run a long jumper underneath the SMC.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light,
threads.message: going to use the original smc, checked <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> on the chip is 0.700
